captions.text:
Good morning Hank; it’s Wednesday. As you
know, sometimes a Nerdfighter meets another

Nerdfighter and they fall in Nerdfighterlike.
Well, today I present you with four stories
of nerd love in all its many splendors!

Let’s begin with Phil and TJ. Hank, you
may remember that a couple years ago I was

part of a Nerdfighter marriage proposal. Nerdfighter
flashback!

2009 John: Is Phil there with you, by the
way?
TJ: Yes he is.
2009 John: Will you marry him?
TJ: Holy... yes!
2009 John: Yeaaaaah! Hey, she said yes! Gaaah!

2011 John: So Hank, update! Not only are Phil
and TJ happily married, they are expecting

their first child! Huzzah! Woah! Woah woah
woah! It looks like I got so excited about

Phil and TJ’s baby that I had an accident.
And now I am seated in a pool of cheap champagne.
What’s new?

Anyway Hank, TJ has one of the funniest blogs
on the entire internet chronicling this pregnancy

with helpful diagrams of her fetus eating
its feet and stuff. Check it out, Hank, link

in the doobly-doo, although I should note
that that blog does contain frank language.

I mean, to be fair, it’s possible to be
pregnant without cursing, but it’s definitely
not advisable.

Story number two! Conner and Amy. God, there
is a lot of champagne in my pants right now.

Okay, Hank, a boy and his Air Force bear go
into the woods. Hold on. Yeah, I thought that

sentence might be unprecedented. So a boy
and his Air Force bear go into the woods,

and they ask Amy to Homecoming. Then the boy
submits the picture to Eff Yeah Nerdfighters,

they run it, and a few days later she responds:
"Dear Conner, Homecoming sounds beautiful.

I’ll paint my nails electric blue in honor
of Alaska." GAH! Hank, it’s so cute I can

hardly bear it! Get it? Bear it? Because of
the bear! I’m drunk, aren’t I? I’m drunk

because there’s champagne in my chair that’s
traveled into my pants, that’s then gone

through my skin and into my body. I’m not
a scientist, but I believe that’s called
osmosis.

Anyway Hank, they did go to Homecoming, but
you know, that was six months ago, which in

Nerdfighterlike is a long time, and we all
know that every relationship ends, you know:

either breakup, divorce, or death. So, the
update is THEY’RE STILL TOGETHER! Yes!

Story three: My face plus your torso equals
Nerdfighterlike. So Hank, I recently got an

email from Janice, pictured here, in which
she told me that she was wearing her Pizza

John shirt in her Elementary Statistics class
because, you know, what else are you going

to wear to Elementary Statistics? And this
boy Andrew walked up to her and said “Are

you a Nerdfighter?” and she said “Nah,
I just love pizza and men with creeper mustaches”--

No, she said yes, she said "Yes I’m a Nerdfighter."
And then he was like “I’m on my way to

a GAS meeting. The Gaming and Anime Society?
Perhaps you’d like to join me.” And of

course she said yes and now they’re in Nerdfighterlike.
Huzzah!

GAS, the Gaming and Anime Society? Couldn’t
you have called it the Society for Anime and
Gaming? SAG?

Story four: The boy from the bookstore. Okay
Hank, so a few weeks ago a Nerdfighter is

in a Barnes and Noble in Bel Air, Maryland.
She gets to talking to a cute boy, and it

turns out that they are both Nerdfighters,
but then they go their separate ways without

exchanging any kind of contact information!
And then this girl writes us and says "Can

you please help me track down my Nerdfighter
crush?" So listen up! If you are five foot

seven, you have brown hair and blue eyes,
and you were recently in the Bel Air, Maryland

Barnes and Noble talking to a girl about Nerdfighting,
let us know.

Hank, those are my stories of nerd love. I
hope they made you as happy as they made me.

Three other things: first, this shiny little
number, Will Grayson, Will Grayson just came

out in paperback yesterday. If you want to
buy it, there’s a link to do so in the doobly-doo.

Secondly, Nerdfighters, do you have any Nerdfighterlike
stories? If so, leave them in comments. And

finally Hank, your videos about Haiti continue
to be an inspiration to me and to all of Nerdfighteria.

To thank you, I have made a three hundred
dollar gift to Water.org. Nerdfighters, if

you would like to join me in giving and following
our community in Haiti, check out the link
in the doobly-doo.

It occurs to me that there are a lot of links
in the doobly-doo today, but they’re all

good ones! Hank, I’m gonna go change pants.
I’ll see you on Friday.

comments.text:
So this isn't a nerdfighting story, but a story of nerd love anyway. One of 
my friends had a french exchange student, and the exchange student and my 
other friend fell in love. One problem: she didn't speak English nor him 
French. They found a solution though. They could both speak fluid Klingon, 
and for a year they spoke Klingon to each other until she learned enough 
English and him French. Two years later and they're happily married....﻿
comments.author: Panic Moon

comments.text:
My high school sweet heart and I met when I got a copy of and graphic novel 
version of the Hobbit down for her in the library. We used to spend our 
Saturday nights watching Crash Course, because you know Nerdfighters. The 
most adorable part is when I went away to college we used to read each 
other John Green books over Skype before bed each night. We are no longer 
together but she will always hold a special place in my heart and I hope 
one day we will be able to be good friends again.﻿

and are still dating. ﻿

comments.text:
Earlier in November a boy from my school asked me to go see Mockingjay with 
him. I knew him vaguely because he is a junior and I'm a freshman. Both of 
us are on the school's Quiz Bowl club and we are very nerdy. He picks me up 
on our date and the first thing he says (other than acknowledging me 
looking cute) was, "Did you get anything for Pizzamas?" 
About a month has past and we have been in strong nerdfighterlike. We've 
gone to Christmas Ball together and enjoy hanging out with each other. I'm 
so lucky to have a Nerdfighter boyfriend! ﻿

comments.text:
I haven't got any Nerdfighter love stories yet, but once I was in History 
class and our teacher was talking about the Civil War and how unfair it was 
and how we are all human beings and she was getting all metaphorical and 
she asked us, "Are you human?"
To which I, being the mad Doctor Who fan that I am, replied with, "No, I'm 
an alien from Raxicoricafallapatorious". 
A guy named Alex who sits directly in front of me turned, stared at me, and 
then, with this odd sort of smirk on his face, said pointedly, "Fantastic!"
Best. History lecture. Ever.﻿
comments.author: I'mGlowing :D

comments.text:
I know of a nerdfighterlike story, but I can't find it. I remember it was 
in the comments in a vlogbrothers video, and it was just really freaking 
cute. A girl and a guy started talking about the video and it led into a 
huge comment chain in which they started adorably flirting with nerdy 
references. One of them said "just so you know, seeing your reply pop up in 
my email is the highlight of my day."

They then talked about how much they wanted to meet each other, but 
couldn't because they were broke teenagers. It was ongoing when I found it 
around April last year, so I need to know what happened! Can someone help?﻿
comments.author: Alanna R.

comments.text:
My boyfriend asked me out with a monologue kind of thing for the animated 
Batman from the 90s. In the first Mr. Freeze episode, he starts talking 
about how he would kill not only to avenge his wife, but to feel warm 
things again.  So my boyfriend said to me "Aurora, I would love to walk on 
a summer's day with the hot wind in my face and a warm hand to hold, but I 
can't do that because I have a heart of ice. I think you thawed my heart 
out." I did not correct his grammar like I probably should have at the 
time, but I said yes because the feels were too much and this happened at 
work with everyone watching us.  Now we do not talk to each other, work 
together, see each other at all, or date. I need a new nerdfighter.﻿

comments.text:
Brenda Pineda, a nerdfighter is someone who accepts others, does happy 
dances, reads books, cries because they care about books, and a whole lot 
of other stuff (minecraft, nerd music, vlogbrothers) but it is pretty much 
summed up by "Don't Forget To Be Awesome". You are already a nerdfighter, 
because you are already awesome, just don't forget it.

If you are still kinda confuzed, then you should just watch some more 
vlogbrothers videos and get in touch with the nerdfighter community 
(commenting on newer vlogbrother videos is probably the easiest way).﻿

lol that is todays "version" of bullieing. they seemed to have the idea in

you were blunt and to the point that was my only point in saying that 
because it is a real thing but people overexagerate and get out of controle 
with that turm and as for love it very well could but probable not with 
their first girl friend or at that age and most of the people in the world 
act like there first "love" loves them back let alown will stay with them 
forever. hence teen pregnancy and very often single teen moms. I wanted to 
try to make a statement of all of this because it is a place where many 
kids are and I believ no madder how you ment the comment that you know 
more  than us kids as well as deserve more respect because you have lived 
and we have not. simpley dont expect the best but be happy and carefull 
while you are there dont complain about things that you are doing and 
respect your elders they might just be able to give you advice and make you 
laugh about life. And my biggest point at least to them dont take things so 
personal your gona kill yourselfs. (yes this is alot of thought for 
probably little point)

comments.author: Timothy Dingman

comments.text:
Okay, first of all, therapy isn't an insult, it's not a threat, and it's 
not BAD. That seems to be a go-to response with some people like yourself, 
telling someone that they need therapy. Do you have any idea how many 
hundreds of thousands of people receive therapy regularly? It's a wonderful 
tool. Never mind the fact that you really aren't qualified to tell someone 
whether or not they should seek professional help.

Second of all, I don't feel a "desperate need" to pursue this thread. I'm 
just sitting here at my computer so responding is convenient. I really 
couldn't care less about anything said here.

Third, assuming that was a legitimate offer, I don't think that would be 
very helpful, given that I probably don't live in your area nor would I be 
able to afford such an expense.

Kay, I'm done here, hope all works out for you and everything. Have a nice 
day.
comments.author: Mikayla Bone

comments.text:
Mikayla,  if you feel the desperate need to pursue this thread further, 
I'll give you the names of some goo therapists I know
comments.author: Timothy Dingman

comments.text:
No one said it was your responsibility to make people happy. Just asking 
that you not make them cry. Whatever, man. I really don't care and it 
doesn't look like anyone can win with you. That's great you're kids still 
talk to you, I never said they didn't
comments.author: Mikayla Bone

comments.text:
1. I didn't mean to make her cry
2.  You have no idea of what a great time it has been to raise two boys by 
myself
3. It is not my responsibility to make other people happy, especially about 
my behaviour 
4. My children, 22 years later, still talk to me and care about me.  I wish 
you the same results when you are a doddering 66 year old

comments.text:
This entire comments thread just makes me sad. +Timothy Dingman, I really 
am sorry for your situation, and I have no idea what it's like to raise two 
children on your own, so much respect to you for that. But I don't know how 
you expected to post about that time you made a presumably 16 year old girl 
cry on a video about nerd love and expect to get a positive response from 
people.
comments.author: Mikayla Bone

comments.text: this was 10 years ago.  He seems to have gotten over it.
comments.author: Timothy Dingman

comments.text: +Timothy Dingman You can do something about it
comments.author: VASHTI PERSAUD

comments.text:
I am impotent.  There is nothing I can do to make Alex feel better or to 
bring back his friend.  I can do nothing to help anyone.  I'm  not just 
upset; I'm angry.  Suicides intend this. It's the ultimate revenge for all 
of the  slights, lack of acknowledgements and lack of understanding and 
comfort and insights that they have ever experienced and been unable to 
solicit.

I'm sorry to say that, mostly, I'm angry about the way it impacts my child
comments.author: Timothy Dingman

comments.text: +Timothy Dingman You're upset.
comments.author: VASHTI PERSAUD

comments.text:
no kidding?  rude?  This morning at 7:12 AM, my younger son called me to 
tell me that one of his friends/peers had come home to NJ from Louisiana to 
hang himself in his parents house. Tell me more about everything you know 
about human relations and interactivity; I think that I can spare the 3 
seconds it will take.

comments.text:
+Timothy Dingman I‘m not talking about parenting. What you did was not nice 
even if you are a friend or just some random person. What if he really 
liked that girl? Imagine how it would feel like to him if you spoiled the 
one chance he got with her. Finding a girl he likes and actually gets the 
nerve to talk to her is not that easy, less so when she says yes too. 
Especially when he's just 16, it is a difficult age for anyone, so why make 
it even harder for him?

comments.text:
I've been a Nerdfighter since the beginning of the year -- it's not too 
impressive, but I have a small story, even though this is kind of late! :) 
I've been trying to get my family to join me as Nerdfighters but they 
didn't really care, but then one day I made my older brother watch 'How to 
be a Nerdfighter' and he's now a Nerdfighter! And my Grandma, cousin/best 
friend, and a few friends at school love TFiOS. :)﻿

comments.author: Jordyn McEvoy

comments.text:
My nerdfighter like story:
Found out about a new game called SMITE Sept 20th(ish) 2012. I liked it on 
Facebook, and the first post I see is about the actually developers of the 
game doing a live stream of the game itself on a website called Twitch.tv. 
Basically a gamer's streaming website with a chat box that the streamer can 
interact with his community through. WELL, while watching the stream one of 
the moderators for the developers chat, named Mika, noted she was having 
problems with her Minecraft game to another one of the chatters. Given I 
was obsessed with Minecraft at the time and basically knew the in's and 
out's of it, I sent her a private message to her inbox of twitch, asking if 
I could help. After a few hours of chatting we still couldn't get it fixed 
but the stream ended and so we both left the website. I started up the game 
of SMITE, which if you don't actually know about it, it's a newer MOBA 
that's come out like LoL, or DOTA2, and grouped up with one of my friends 
I'd met also from the stream. Turns out he was friends with the moderator 
Mika, and invited her to the party we were in as well. Since we were in 
Skype, he invited her to skype, too! So we're all talking, having a jolly 
good time, I mention I'm the one who was helping her with minecraft, 
suggest adding each other, she agreed, we continued talking past the 
gameplay of SMITE, and come Oct 12, 2012 I asked her out because we loved 
spending time together playing games of all kinds (at the time it was more 
of just SMITE and Minecraft) and enjoyed spending time on Twitch, she said 
yes which was some what funny because we were kind of already in that huggy 
flirty kind of friendly relationship up to that point, and we've been 
together ever since. Let me also note that she lives in New York, and I 
live in Tennessee. Long distance nerdfighteria like CAN work.
As an added bonus halfway through the relationship up to this point she 
asked what I was doing one day, and I told her watching youtube. She asked 
what I was watching, and I described to her the basic back and forth 
between two brothers through relatively awesome clips involving random 
topics, and the first thing she says was "Oh, that sounds a lot like 
vlogbrothers."  I MEAN REALLY!? THIS WOMAN IS A NERDFIGHTER TOO!? To this 
day she continues to blow my mind with things I learn about her and will 
probably continue to learn about her for the rest of the, hopefully, long 
time we spend together. Currently 'life' intervenes on any possibility of 
us actually being able to meet, basically due to financial issues, but one 
day soon we hope to at least be able to visit one another.﻿
comments.author: Drk lucian (Drk1lucian)
